00023 package ikayaki;
00024 
00025 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00026 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00027 
00028 import javax.vecmath.Matrix3d;
00029 import javax.vecmath.Vector3d;
00030 
00039 public class MeasurementResult {
00040 
00044     private final Type type;
00045 
00049     private final int rotation;
00050 
00054     private final Vector3d rawVector = new Vector3d();
00055 
00059     private final Vector3d sampleVector = new Vector3d();
00060 
00065     private final Vector3d geographicVector = new Vector3d();
00066 
00080     public MeasurementResult(Type type, int rotation, double x, double y, double z) {
00081         if (type == null) {
00082             throw new NullPointerException();
00083         }
00084         if ((type == Type.NOISE || type == Type.HOLDER) && rotation != 0) {
00085             throw new IllegalArgumentException("type = " + type + ", rotation = " + rotation);
00086         }
00087         this.type = type;
00088         this.rotation = rotation % 360;
00089         rawVector.set(x, y, z);
00090         applyFixes(null);
00091         setTransform(null);
00092     }
00093 
00103     public MeasurementResult(Element element) {
00104         if (element == null) {
00105             throw new NullPointerException();
00106         }
00107 
00108         // verify tag name
00109         if (!element.getTagName().equals("result")) {
00110             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid tag name: " + element.getTagName());
00111         }
00112 
00113         // get type
00114         String s = element.getAttribute("type");
00115         try {
00116             this.type = Type.valueOf(s);
00117         } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
00118             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid type: " + s, e);
00119         }
00120 
00121         // get rotation
00122         s = element.getAttribute("rotation");
00123         try {
00124             int rotation = Integer.parseInt(s) % 360;
00125             while (rotation < 0) {
00126                 rotation += 360;
00127             }
00128             this.rotation = rotation;
00129         } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
00130             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid rotation: " + s, e);
00131         }
00132 
00133         // verify type and rotation
00134         if ((type == Type.NOISE || type == Type.HOLDER) && rotation != 0) {
00135             throw new IllegalArgumentException("type = " + type + ", rotation = " + rotation);
00136         }
00137 
00138         // get x, y, z
00139         try {
00140             rawVector.set(Double.parseDouble(element.getAttribute("x")),
00141                     Double.parseDouble(element.getAttribute("y")),
00142                     Double.parseDouble(element.getAttribute("z")));
00143         } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
00144             throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid x, y or z: " + e.getMessage(), e);
00145         }
00146 
00147         // initialize sampleVector and geographicVector
00148         applyFixes(null);
00149         setTransform(null);
00150     }
00151 
00157     public Element getElement(Document document) {
00158         Element element = document.createElement("result");
00159 
00160         element.setAttribute("type", type.name());
00161         element.setAttribute("rotation", Integer.toString(rotation));
00162         element.setAttribute("x", Double.toString(rawVector.x));
00163         element.setAttribute("y", Double.toString(rawVector.y));
00164         element.setAttribute("z", Double.toString(rawVector.z));
00165 
00166         return element;
00167     }
00168 
00176     protected void applyFixes(MeasurementStep step) {
00177         sampleVector.set(rawVector);
00178 
00179         // TODO: in which order should the rotation, +-Z, holder and noise fixes be applied??
00180 
00181         // apply rotation fix
00182         if (rotation % 90 == 0) {
00183             // accurate and fast algorithm for trivial angles
00184             switch (rotation) {
00185             case 0:
00186                 // NO NEED TO ROTATE
00187                 break;
00188             case 90:
00189                 sampleVector.set(sampleVector.y, -sampleVector.x, sampleVector.z);
00190                 break;
00191             case 180:
00192                 sampleVector.set(-sampleVector.x, -sampleVector.y, sampleVector.z);
00193                 break;
00194             case 270:
00195                 sampleVector.set(-sampleVector.y, sampleVector.x, sampleVector.z);
00196                 break;
00197             default:
00198                 assert false;
00199                 throw new IllegalStateException("rotation = " + rotation);
00200             }
00201         } else {
00202             // rotate all non-trivial angles by using a matrix
00203             Matrix3d rotate = new Matrix3d();
00204             rotate.rotZ(Math.toRadians(-rotation));
00205             rotate.transform(sampleVector);
00206         }
00207 
00208         if (step != null) {
00209             // apply the noise fix
00210             Vector3d noise = step.getNoise();
00211             sampleVector.sub(noise);
00212 
00213             // apply the +/-Z fix
00214             if (step.getProject() != null && step.getProject().getOrientation() == Project.Orientation.MINUS_Z) {
00215                 sampleVector.set(sampleVector.x, -sampleVector.y, -sampleVector.z);
00216             }
00217 
00218             // apply the sample holder fix
00219             Vector3d holder = step.getHolder();     // will be zero, if this project is the holder calibration project
00220             sampleVector.sub(holder);
00221         }
00222 
00223         // reset geographic vector
00224         setTransform(null);
00225     }
00226 
00233     protected void setTransform(Matrix3d transform) {
00234         if (transform != null) {
00235             transform.transform(sampleVector, geographicVector);
00236         } else {
00237             geographicVector.set(sampleVector);
00238         }
00239     }
00240 
00244     public Type getType() {
00245         return type;
00246     }
00247 
00251     public int getRotation() {
00252         return rotation;
00253     }
00254 
00262     public double getGeographicX() {
00263         if (type != Type.SAMPLE) {
00264             throw new IllegalStateException();
00265         }
00266         return geographicVector.x;
00267     }
00268 
00276     public double getGeographicY() {
00277         if (type != Type.SAMPLE) {
00278             throw new IllegalStateException();
00279         }
00280         return geographicVector.y;
00281     }
00282 
00290     public double getGeographicZ() {
00291         if (type != Type.SAMPLE) {
00292             throw new IllegalStateException();
00293         }
00294         return geographicVector.z;
00295     }
00296 
00301     protected Vector3d getGeographicVector() {
00302         return geographicVector;
00303     }
00304 
00308     public double getSampleX() {
00309         return sampleVector.x;
00310     }
00311 
00315     public double getSampleY() {
00316         return sampleVector.y;
00317     }
00318 
00322     public double getSampleZ() {
00323         return sampleVector.z;
00324     }
00325 
00330     protected Vector3d getSampleVector() {
00331         return sampleVector;
00332     }

00337     public double getRawX() {
00338         return rawVector.x;

00344     public double getRawY() {

00351     public double getRawZ() {
00352         return rawVector.z;

00354 
00359     protected Vector3d getRawVector() {
00360         return rawVector;
00361     }

00363     public enum Type {
00364         SAMPLE, HOLDER, NOISE
00365     }
